cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.RO, cs.SE, cs.PL. 

The paper discusses a representation for policies that express reactive behavior for an agent, which involves a decision component and an online planning capability. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category, which deals with intelligent agents and their decision-making processes. Additionally, the paper mentions the analysis of the flow of executing the reactive policy, which could fall under the sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG), which deals with the analysis of learning algorithms. The planning component of the policy could also suggest that the paper belongs to the Robotics (cs.RO) sub-category, which deals with the design and control of robots. The paper also discusses the flexibility of the representation, which could suggest that it belongs to the Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-category, which deals with the design and development of software systems. Finally, the paper mentions the use of action languages, which could suggest that it belongs to the Programming Languages (cs.PL) sub-category, which deals with the design and implementation of programming languages.
